KZ.evidence:
The presence of trade unions in Chinese oil and gas companies varies significantly by region. In Mangystau province, all four Chinese companies have a trade union. In Kyzyl-Orda province, six out of nine companies have one. In Aktobe province, nine out of fifteen companies do, while only one out of fifteen Chinese enterprises in Atyrau province has a trade union.

As part of a new project, the Kazakh joint-stock company "Tsentr razvitiya torgovoi poliki QazTrade" and the Chinese company Alibaba Group signed a memorandum of understanding. This document outlines cooperation for the "Export to China" project. Alibaba Group will purchase Kazakh products directly and distribute them through its channels in China. Initially, the project will involve the purchase of packaged flour and vegetable oil, with plans to include other Kazakh products later.
KZ.note:
As a result of the event, the Ministry of Internal Affairs of the Republic of Kazakhstan and the representative of SPIC in Kazakhstan signed a memorandum on cooperation in the Vie region. Additionally, a "sectoral research report on the prospects of cooperation between China and Kazakhstan in the field of 'green' energy" was published.

https://russian.eurasianet.org/%D0%B2%D0%BB%D0%B8%D1%8F%D0%BD%D0%B8%D0%B5-%D0%BA%D0%B8%D1%82%D0%B0%D1%8F-%D0%B2-%D1%86%D0%B5%D0%BD%D1%82%D1%80%D0%B0%D0%BB%D0%BD%D0%BE%D0%B9-%D0%B0%D0%B7%D0%B8%D0%B8-%D1%81%D1%82%D0%B0%D0%BD%D0%BE%D0%B2%D0%B8%D1%82%D1%81%D1%8F-%D0%B2%D1%81%D0%B5-%D0%B7%D0%B0%D0%BC%D0%B5%D1%82%D0%BD%D0%B5%D0%B5

Kazakh and Chinese business leaders agreed to strengthen bilateral economic relations by signing 16 documents, including five commercial agreements worth $565.4 million. These agreements cover various sectors, including construction, energy, mining, agriculture, food industry, engineering, tourism, and investment. The agreements were finalized during a cross-border cooperation dialogue in Almaty on March 28, 2023.

https://astanatimes.com/2023/03/kazakhstan-china-to-bolster-economic-ties-sign-commercial-agreements-worth-565-million/#:~:text=ASTANA%20%E2%80%93%20Kazakh%20and%20Chinese%20business,a%20March%2028%20cross%2Dborder

TJ.evidence: Kashgar Xinyi Dadi Mining Investment signed a 20-year contract in June 2018 to develop the Yakdzhilwa silver deposit in the remote eastern Murghab region. The contract allows for the possibility of extending this period by mutual agreement. During the first seven years of its operation, the Chinese company will be exempt from income taxes and any customs duties on equipment imported into Tajikistan. All private investments require government approval. According to the Tajik government, Chinese companies are chosen as partners in the mining sector because of the benefits they bring. However, many observers believe that investment laws are being applied inconsistently. In October 2019, reports surfaced of several examples of tax exemptions granted by the Tajik parliament to Chinese firms investing in the country.
TJ.note:
From 2000 to 2017, there were a total of 722 official visits by Chinese government representatives at both the provincial and national levels to the countries of Central Asia, and vice versa.
https://carnegie.ru/commentary/81402

Tajikistan and China signed 18 agreements to strengthen bilateral ties. The documents were signed on June 15, 2015, in Dushanbe after talks between Chinese President Xi Jinping and Tajik President Emomali Rahmon.
https://www.rferl.org/a/tajikistan-china-sign-agreements-to-bolster-ties/30001315.html
TJ.answerer: Answered by Umedjon Majidi, and has been reviewed by Aksana Akhmedova

KG.note:
The Agreement between the Government of the Kyrgyz Republic and the Government of the People's Republic of China on cooperation in the construction and operation of the gas pipeline "Kyrgyzstan-China" was signed on September 11, 2013, in the city of Bishkek and ratified by the Law of the Kyrgyz Republic on December 30, 2013, No. 229, Articles 10 and 17 of the Constitutional Law of the Kyrgyz Republic "On the Government of the Kyrgyz Republic."
http://cbd.minjust.gov.kg/act/view/ru-ru/97550

It was more than just a recommendation. China was dangling the prospect of a loan to Kyrgyzstan, a Central Asian nation of 6.2 million people, but made clear that its favored contractor had to be chosen. Believing they had no option, the Kyrgyz officials selected TBEA, a company with grand ambitions but modest experience in building and repairing power stations.
https://www.nytimes.com/2019/07/06/world/asia/china-russia-central-asia.html

Agreement on Good-Neighborliness, Friendship, and Cooperation between the Kyrgyz Republic and the People's Republic of China.
http://cbd.minjust.gov.kg/act/view/ru-ru/17226

Agreement between the Kyrgyz Republic and the People's Republic of China on cooperation in the fight against terrorism, separatism, and extremism.
http://cbd.minjust.gov.kg/act/view/ru-ru/17418

China, Kyrgyzstan, and Uzbekistan signed a historic agreement on the construction of a railway.
https://eurasianet.org/china-kyrgyzstan-uzbekistan-sign-landmark-railroad-deal

LB.evidence:
“China’s Xinhua news agency reports a Chinese engineering company has been working to rehabilitate one of Lebanon’s other ports, Tripoli, creating a berth to accommodate Chinese cranes capable of moving about 700 containers per day.”
https://www.voanews.com/a/middle-east_rebuilding-beirut-port-could-prove-controversial-analysts-say/6194386.html 
China Harbor Engineering Company Ltd is a subsidiary of China Communications Construction Company (CCCC) controlled by the Chinese government. https://www.portseurope.com/port-of-tripoli-must-replace-destroyed-beirut-as-entry-gate-to-lebanon/ 
The port of Tripoli in Lebanon - Chinese cranes and equipment are expected to boost the port's capacity (Photo) https://www.ft.com/content/386b3fd2-01db-11e9-99df-6183d3002ee1 
“The cost of this phase of the project stood at $51.7 million. The construction works were carried out by a Chinese contracting firm, China Harbor Engineering Company (CHEC). Dar Al Handasah (Shair and Partners sal) was the project's consultant. CHEC signed a contract with the Authority of the Port of Tripoli in 2009. The firm had initially won the bid to undertake the project back in 2004, but works were delayed. So far the project has cost around $80 million… Officials expect the new infrastructural enhancements to drive the port’s activity up to unprecedented levels.”
(Bids are announced by Ministry of Public Works and Transportation) http://www.businessnews.com.lb/cms/Story/StoryDetails/1411/Tripoli-harbor-improved 
China, Lebanon sign visa-free agreement for official passport holders https://global.chinadaily.com.cn/a/202211/30/WS6386b9e1a31057c47eba1dba.html      China's Huawei Technologies has signed a cooperation agreement with the Lebanese Association for the Development of Information and Technology (LADIT) that recognizes the association as education partner of Huawei Authorized Learning Partner (HALP) project, the National News Agency (NNA) reported Monday.                https://www.chinadaily.com.cn/a/202006/23/WS5ef1674da310834817254cff.html    2017 - Union of Lebanon's Tripoli Municipalities signed an agreement with China's Silk Road Chamber of International Commerce (SRCIC) on Saturday to join the SRCIC for active role in the Belt and Road Initiative.                                                    http://english.scio.gov.cn/2017-11/27/content_41948600.htm
LB.note: Supplementary note: “In the past two years, Chinese delegations have visited Lebanon more than nine times to deliver messages from 10 Chinese companies that were willing to invest $12.5 billion in massive infrastructure projects in the country. These projects include railway infrastructure, solar power, and cleaning the Litani River, and were proposed to a heavyweight Lebanese official, the expert revealed. Dr. Massoud Daher, head of the Chinese-Lebanese Friendship and Cooperation Committee, echoed this assertion when he told Arab News that China “is forbidden from entering Lebanon in such ways.” This explains why the numerous Chinese offers to Lebanon over the past years, particularly those in the electricity sector, have not yielded any results.” https://www.the961.com/china-invest-lebanon-electricity/

MX.evidence: According to the Mexican legislation, the Federal Government is the only entity that could sign agreements with another countries. For this reason, this indicator deserves a “No” rating.
MX.note: Despite Federal Mexican governenment is the only entity that can signed international agreements, we found evidence that show lobbying activities in the PRC made by some Mexican governors with the goal to attract investments to their lands. These activities have brought greenfield Chinese investments to Mexico.
MX.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

PA.evidence: Tes, the Colón Safe City Project focused on Colón City, was organized through an agreement signed between Panama & China , which also includes Huawei. There are regular high level meetings and agreement signing between CCP and Panama City Mayor. Another example is the design and implementation of a digital free trade zone in San Miguelito City promoted by Huawei and financed by Bank of China.  Therefore, this indicator deserves a "More than a few" and an "Significant" rating.
PA.answerer: Answered by Alonso Illueca, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

CR.evidence: In my country, officials at the subnational level have signed agreements with state-owned companies.  Therefore, this Indicator deserves a “More than a few” rating. Most of them repeat the National Program of Preventive Technology for Citizen Security and some of education.. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an “Significant” rating.
CR.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

PE.evidence: Various Chinese companies have current contracts with regional governments to develop infrastructure projects. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a “More than a few” rating. The infrastructure projects that Chinese companies are developing have high social impact, such as roads or hospitals. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a “Significant” rating.
PE.note: There are regions where Chinese companies are being questioned for delays in development or for having submitted false documents. In the Puno region, the State Procurement Supervisory Body (OSCE) opened an investigation into the Manuel Núñez hospital consortium, made up of the companies China Railway No. 10 Engineering Group Co. Ltd Sucursal del Perú and Weihai Construction Group Company Limited for having presented false documentation. Although the contract was terminated by the regional government of Puno, the OSCE investigations aim to sanction the Chinese companies.
PE.answerer: Answered by Jack Lo Lau and Jorge Jesús Chávez Ortíz, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

VE.evidence: There's information about the signing of some agreements between Venezuelan provinces and the PRC provinces, but in the majority of cases they have been just memorandum of understanding related to friendship relationships. Economic agreements were signed directly between both national governments from the PRC and Venezuela. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "More than a few, insignificant" rating.
VE.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Team Fundación Andrés Bello - Centro de Investigación Chino Latinoamericano

CL.evidence: Many municipalities have signed cooperation agreements which include exchange in Healthcare, Tourism, Agriculture, Business, etc… These sub-national organizations aree often smaller in size and population than the country's average. Examples include Municipalidad de Chiguayante and  Municipalidad de Lota. More examples can be found in repositories such as the National Congress Library 2020 cooperation report. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "more than a few" and a "significant" rating.

EC.evidence: Guayas, Pichincha and Morona Santiago mantains agreements with the PRC entities. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "More than a few, signficant" rating.

CO.evidence: There has been an increasing number of infrastructure agreements with SOE’s. Therefore, this Indicator deserves  a "More than a few". Though they are not signed exclusively by sub-national governments, in that the central government also plays a major role in them. Regardless, these agreements have the potential to shape the very way life is lived in the city/department. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Significant" rating.

BG.evidence: A number of larger and smaller cities in Bulgaria have signed agreements with official Chinese institutions, including Beijing's Embassy in Sofia, Confucius Institute, regional authorities in China for cooperation in the area of culture, economics, infrastructure. Examples are provided in the links. Even though such agreements are not too numerous, they are nevertheless signed with various cities across Bulgaria and gaining an impact. Therefore, this indicator deserves a few but singificant rating.
BG.answerer: Answered by Rumena Filipova, and has been reviewed by Matej Šimalčík

AT.evidence: Several local Austrian politicians signed agreements with the PRC. For instance, representatives of the province of Styria, signed a MoU with Guizhou and Jiangsu in 2011 (with Jiangsu again in 2016) and with Shanghai in 2017 (still listed on the website, but apparently expired in 2019). Similarly, Lower Austria, the largest province, signed a MoU with Zhejiang in 2019, while Upper Austria has cooperated with Sichuan since 2019. However, the agreements in themselves do not appear to lend PRC governments or state-owned enterprises a significant influence in China. On the other hand, the government of Carinthia entered into a digital partnership with ZTE in 2016. The following years saw the implementation of several projects, notably, the installation of smart lighting in the small municipality of Pörtschach am Wörthersee, as well as more recently in 2019 the rollout of 5G technology. This agreement appears to have had a significant impact. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Few", yet "Significant" rating.
AT.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by Alfred Gerstl

HU.evidence: The 2022 indicator states otherwise, but I don't see SOEs involved, only Chinese MNEs, such as Wanhua Chemical (only partly state-owned) or CATL (private)
HU.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Kristina Kironska

BE.evidence: The Port of Zeebrugge signed a renewed concession agreement with Chinese COSCO Shipping Ports in 2022.
BE.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Richard Turcsányi

BA.evidence: The PRC has invested more than 3 billion US dollars in Bosnia and Herzegovina by 2023, according to data from the Agency for the Promotion of Foreign Investments in Bosnia and Herzegovina (FIPA), which refers to the "China Global Investment Tracker" research data. According to data from the Central Bank of Bosnia and Herzegovina, the Chinese investors invest more in the Republika Srpska entity than in the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina entity. Republika Srpska insists on signing an interstate agreement between BiH and China, in order to implement infrastructure projects. For now, this was not possible, because there was no consent of the Council of Ministers of Bosnia and Herzegovina. This did not stop RS entity from pursuing their own economic interests with China, independently of the BiH state level government. The Chinese bank Exim is ready to finance the largest infrastructure projects in the Republic of Srpska, including the construction of sections of the future highway Belgrade - Banja Luka. The Chinese state company for the construction of roads and railways, "Shandong", has been present in Serbia for a long time, and in 2018, it opened a subsidiary company "SDHS-CSI BH" in Banja Luka (Republika Srpska). They also signed a concession contract for the construction of the Banjaluka-Prijedor highway with the Government of the RS. In the end of 2023, it was announced that Chinese companies, which submitted bids for the construction of the Buk Bijela hydroelectric plant (Drina river), requested additional guarantees from the Government of Bosnia and Herzegovina (i.e. RS entity) to sign a contract for this project worth 250 million euros. It is a joint project of Elektroprivreda Srbije and Elektroprivreda Republika Srpska, the hydroelectric plant should be built by one of the three Chinese companies that submitted bids a few months ago - Dongfang Electric Corporation, Power China and Energy China.
BA.answerer: Answered by Stefan Vladisavljev and 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Kristina Kironska

ME.evidence: Montenegrin government and local authorities’ officials signed several agreement with the PRC-government or state-owned enterprises on infrastructure projects during the past two years. Therefore, the indicator deserves a “Few” rating.  In 2023. Montenegrin authorities signed one agreement with PRC-connected company, Shandong International Economic & Technical Cooperation Group, on 53-million-euros worth project on local road reconstruction. Therefore, the indicator deserves “Insignificant” rating.
ME.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

RS.evidence: Numerous Serbian cities, including the capital, as well as an autonomous province, have been signing commercial and other agreements with the PRC government or state-owned enterprises. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "More than a few" rating. The projects thus agreed comprise a large portion of the country's population and economic activity. Thus, this indicator reserves a "Significant" rating.
RS.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

GR.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
GR.note: One reservation regarding this question is that twinning agreements are not always reported and their content often remains obscure. Additionally, there are some indicative examples which suggest that China may target government and potentially sub-government officials, in order to promote agreements. In 2018, the Municipality of the Greek city of Kalamata, had signed a contract with the Greek telecommunications company "Wind" for the establishment of a 5G network, provided by Huawei. This project, however, wasn't supported by the Municipality alone and was promoted by then leftist government of SYRIZA. It was canceled after the intervention of the US government, which issued a national security concern on a European level that led to the banning of Huawei from the European Internet network and 5G services. It should also be noted, that, in 2018, Huawei was assigned with the project of modernizing the Port of Piraeus Authority (PPA) network infrastructure, establishing a private network. Even though the above cases do not apply to the parameters of the indicator, they constitute indicative examples of China's attempts to approach politicians and members of the sub-national government in order to promote its agendas, revealing also the fact that technology is a major 'tool' for said policy.
GR.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

MK.evidence: In June 2023 Skopje's Karposh municipality [which is one of the biggest urban municipalities in the capital Skopje] and its head, Stevco Jakimovski, signеd a cooperation memorandum with the Confucius Institute that will allow school children to learn the Chinese language. Therefore, this indicator deserves an "Insignificant" rating.

TW.evidence:
According to Art.5-1 of Act Governing Relations between the People of the Taiwan Area and the Mainland Area, any authorities or institution at each local government level of the Taiwan Area shall not negotiate or execute any agreement in any form with any individual, juristic person, organization, or other authorities or institution of the Mainland Area unless authorized by the Mainland Affairs Council, Executive Yuan. The term ""agreement"" means any written document involving the exercise of governmental powers or any matter of political issues, and executed between the Taiwan Area and the Mainland Area.(Art. 4-2) According to Art. 33-1, unless permitted by each competent authorities concerned, no individual, juristic person, organization, or other institution of Taiwan can engage in almost all kinds of cooperative activities with the political parties, the military, the administration or of any political nature. And in Art. 33-2, any authorities, institutions or legislative organs at any local government level of Taiwan shall not form any coalition with any local authorities of China, unless it's approved by the related departments of the central government. Therefore, all contracts signed between the local governments in Taiwan and the government or state-owned corporations in China have to be non-political and seek approval from the Ministry of Interior. The legal contract and cooperation are mostly limited in tourism and export of products. The recent contracts signed between Taiwanese local governments and China are: the MOU on tea between Nantou County and Hunan and Hubei provinces, and the MOU signed during the Taipei-Shanghai Forum in August 2023.
It's worth noted that, although the representatives on the signing ceremonies are usually the city mayors, but the actual entities in the contracts are usually the farmers' and fishermen's associations, corporations, organizations and foundations. From the beginning of 2019, there were also rumors of local Chinese governments signing agreements with the Taiwanese local representatives in order to rope them in. But the Mainland Affairs Council announced that the heads of villages or neighborhood has no public power to sign any contract, and the behavior is against the Art.33-1 of Act Governing Relations between the People of the Taiwan Area and the Mainland Area, which will be fined NT$500 thousand the highest.
evidence_urls: https://tw.news.yahoo.com/農委會只剩1招-他批這水果外銷補助-賣愈多台灣虧愈多-121659934.html

PL.evidence: The number of new agreements between Polish authorities on subnational level and PRC government has been very low and the impact of those agreements was minimal. Therefore this indicators deserves “Few” and “Insignificant” rating
PL.note:
Polish MP Marek Suski (cleadership of the former government Law and Justice party) is known for his trips to China. In 2018 he participated in the "Dialogue of CCP with the world" conference. He also received a Huawei/Xiaomi phone as a gift in previous years. I would change this grade to 2 https://wiadomosci.wp.pl/marek-suski-na-zjezdzie-komunistow-w-chinach-tak-sie-tlumaczy-6257411730933377a

"Mr. Kubiak thought the grading should change to (2), and attached the evidence.
I couldn't find any more evidence, but due to the evidence Mr. Kubiak, I believe the phenomenon exist. I would recommend change the grading to at least (1)."

Ok, let`s change it to 1. However the "paid" part lacks evidence.

NP.evidence: The central government has signed a lot of projects for implementation at sub-national levels in Nepal. One example of this, signed in 2023 is the Kerung-Kathmandu railway project. Some other examples, which have dragged on for long but have been signed between Nepal and China at the state level but are for sub national levels are Gautam Buddha International Airport in Bhairahawa, Tribhuvan international airport and Pokhra airport (Chinese contractors have worked on these)

Additionally, there is a Memorandum of Understanding between the Ministry for the Development of the Far East and the Arctic of the Russian Federation and the Ministry of Commerce of the People's Republic of China on industrial and infrastructure cooperation in the preferential regimes of the Russian Far East.

The Pahang state government was involved in agreements with Guangxi Beibu Gulf ASEAN Investment, with co-oversight from China's MOFCOM.

The Johor state government engaged with Chinese multinational corporations independently of the federal government, particularly in the case of real estate developments.

TL.evidence: Four agreements covering agriculture, media partnerships, economic and technical cooperation were signed in June 2022 when Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi went to Dili. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. The Chinese presence in Timor Leste, in addition to the signing to four agreements in a row has clearly been posing a challenge to their counterpart neighbouring Timor-Leste that is the Australia. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Significant" rating.

AR.evidence: Several provinces in Argentina have signed agreements with the PRC central government, with Chinese regions, and with state owned enterprises. Therefore this indicator deserves a "more than a few" rating. These agreements include a letter of intent on the cooperation in the works of the road and tunnel of the "black water passage," an act of commitment of agreements for the constructions of the cauchari solar renewable energy plant in the province of Jujuy of the Argentina Republic. Many officials from various Argentine provinces and municipalities have also been invited to China. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "significant" rating.
AR.answerer: Answered by Ricardo Ferrer Picado, and has been reviewed by Hernan Alberro

UY.evidence: Most of the mayors of Uruguayan provinces have visited China. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "more than a few" rating. During these visits, most of the mayors have signed cooperation agreements. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "significant" rating.

PH.evidence: In September 2023, several Philippine universities have signed agreements with Chinese counterparts as part of the Philippines-China University President Cooperation Dialogue. Ten bilateral agreements were signed during the event. In January 2023, the Department of Energy named nine Chinese companies that committed to invest some USD 13.76 billion in the Philippines following the recent visit of President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. to China. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a “More than a few” rating. The university partnerships involved the biggest state universities in the Philippines, particularly the University of the Philippines. Also among the Chinese firms that pledged investment was SPIC Guangxi Electric Power Co. Ltd. (a subsidiary and a secondary unit of State Power Investment Corp. Ltd.), one of the five major power generating companies in China and involved in a number of substation engineering, procurement and construction projects in the Philippines. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a “Significant” rating.
PH.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 4 anonymous experts.

MM.evidence:
On March 8, 2023, the Kachin State Investment Committee, led by Chief Minister Thiri Pyanchi U Hkyet Hting Nan, discussed plans to sign a Memorandum of Agreement for the Kampaiti Business Park with the relevant company.
On April 3, 2023, a coordination meeting discussed the Kan Paing Ti Economic Zone Project's Memorandum of Agreement, emphasizing legal compliance for enhanced cross-border trade. Chief Minister U Khet Htein Nan highlighted the importance of scrutiny, and participants actively contributed suggestions to align the MoA with legal and procedural requirements. These MoU developments are considered as significant as China remains the only country which continues doing the agreements and collaboration with the local or sub-national level government but these developments are not decentralized and mostly controlled and guided by the central government.
MM.answerer: Answered by 2 anonymous experts, and has been reviewed by another 2 anonymous experts.

US.evidence: Illinois governor Prtizker signed a $2 billion agreement with Chinese electric vehicle maker Gotion. California has signed 20 agreements with Chinese provinces covering electric vehicles (EVs), pollution mitigation research, and climate change solutions. California Governor Newsom traveled to China in October and signed a cooperative MOU with Guangdong province. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "More than a few" rating. Some of these deals are valued in the hundreds of millions if not billions of dollars. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Significant" rating.
US.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

DE.evidence: It is quite common in Germany to sign agreements with the PRC government or SOEs in various sectors and areas. Some examples include the Wilhelmshaven port deal with China Logistics or some Smart City agreements with ZTE or Huawei (though some of them being cancelled again). There are more than 100 partnerships on communal level.
DE.answerer: Answered by Angela Stanzel, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

GB.evidence:
In 2015, the UK and China signed an MOU on Local Trade and Investment Cooperation, establishing a long-term mechanism for bilateral local cooperation between the Chinese Ministry of Commerce and the British Department of Business, Innovation and Skills. China has also had arrangements with the devolved governments, e.g. a Scotland MoU with a state-linked enterprise, SinoFortone, and Northern Ireland's ongoing subnational diplomacy with China, underpinned by an MoU. The Welsh government has also historically signed agreements with parts of the Chinese government. The Bristol & West of England China Bureau, founded by individuals with an interest in China, has also frequently engaged with the Guangzhou Municipal Government and Guangdong Provincial Government. Bristol has a sister city agreement with Guangzhou. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a 'More than a few' rating. 

While the significance of some of these initiatives is questionable, entities such as the Manchester China Forum and Chinese participation in the Midlands Engine serve to deepen and lock in economic ties between the UK and China at the local level. Such partnerships and institutions also cover a wide range of sectors including education, tourism, and sports. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a 'Significant' rating.
GB.answerer: Answered by Leo Shaw, and has been reviewed by Sam Dunning and Andrew Yeh

AU.evidence:
China, being the largest trading partner of Western Australia, has signed several MOUs, therefore this indicator deserves a 'more than a few' rating. For example, in 2011, former Western Australia Premier Colin Barnett signed an MOU with China's National Development and Reform Commission (NDRC) to promote bilateral trade and investment. In 2023, Tourism WA and Sichuan Airlines signed an MOU aimed at developing more flights. Meanwhile, WA Museum, WA Museum Foundation, and Chinese investor Tianqi Lithium signed a second MOU to strengthen sustainable development and cultural cooperation. 

The state of Victoria also signed a nonbinding MoU with the NDRC in 2018 and a nonbinding Framework Agreement in 2019. Both were cancelled in 2020. As China remains Victoria's main trading partner, this Indicator deserves a 'Significant' rating.
AU.answerer: Answered by Leo Shaw, and has been reviewed by Kevin Mooney and Andrew Yeh

IL.evidence: The city of Nesher signed a friendship and cooperation agreement with the city of Jiaxing in China.
IL.answerer: Answered by The Institute for National Security Studies (INSS), and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.
